title: The future of menus includes upcycled ingredients - Food Business News
summary: The Spare Food Co. has launched Spare Starter, a versatile value-added culinary ingredient made with six vegetables and a proprietary spice blend. It includes parts of vegetables, such as leaves and stalks, which are nutritious but more typically trimmed and discarded. Restaurants that incorporate sustainable sourcing create a point of differentiation when vying for diners’ dollars.
green_innovation: TRUE, The Spare Food Co. has launched a versatile value-added culinary ingredient made with six vegetables and a proprietary spice blend. It includes parts of vegetables, such as leaves and stalks, which are nutritious but are more typically trimmed and discarded.
business_innovation: TRUE, The Spare Food Co. has launched a versatile value-added culinary ingredient that helps to promote a “plant-forward menu that doesn’t compromise on taste” and saves time in the back of house, especially during foodservice labor shortages.
green_product: TRUE, Spare Starter is a versatile value-added culinary ingredient made with six vegetables and a proprietary spice blend. It includes parts of vegetables, such as leaves and stalks, which are nutritious but are more typically trimmed and discarded. It is shelf-stable until opened, and then requires refrigeration. The vegan ingredient helps to promote a “plant-forward menu that doesn’t compromise on taste.”
green_process: TRUE, Spare Starter is made with six vegetables and a proprietary spice blend. It includes parts of vegetables, such as leaves and stalks, which are nutritious but are more typically trimmed and discarded. This helps to reduce food waste and promote a more sustainable food system.

title: How Progressive Grocer's Impact Awards Winners Are Improving the World - Progressive Grocer
summary: ALDI and Alex's Lemonade Stand Foundation (ALSF) have partnered for the past five years to raise funds and awareness for childhood cancer research. This year, for the first time, ALDI donated 50 cents for each ALSF-branded bag of lemons purchased throughout the month of June, up to $1 million. ALDI is on track to donate $10 million to ALSF by 2027.

title: PepsiCo Announces Agriculture Accelerator Projects to Support Farmer Livelihoods, Scale Sustainable Innovation and ... - PR Newswire
summary: PepsiCo's Positive Agriculture Outcomes (PAO) Accelerator will invest $30 million in nearly 40 agricultural projects through 2028. The program supports innovation in sustainable farming practices, such as soil health management and water conservation. PepsiCo aims to spread the adoption of regenerative farming practices across 7 million acres by 2030.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Comments on Tax Court Decision - Yahoo Finance Australia
summary: Coca-Cola is disappointed with the U.S. Tax Court's supplemental opinion in its case against the IRS.  The company believes that the IRS's retroactive tax liability calculation methodology is unconstitutional and plans to appeal the decision. Coca-Cola does not expect this decision to impact its tax reserve or potential tax liability related to the dispute

title: ofi officially opens state-of-the-art dairy processing plant in New Zealand - Food and Drink Technology
summary: Olam Food Ingredients (ofi) has opened a new dairy processing plant in New Zealand to meet the growing demand for dairy ingredients. The plant will produce whole milk powder for customers in the dessert, bakery, beverage, and confectionery categories. This investment is part of ofi's wider natural ingredients portfolio and complements its existing global footprint.

green_process: TRUE, the new dairy processing plant uses green processes to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.

title: Mavala's ultimate guide to beauty features skincare-infused make-up range - Global Travel Retail Magazine
summary: Swiss beauty brand Mavala has introduced its first line of bio-sourced nail polishes, called Mini Bio-Color. The company also launched a new range of skincare-infused make-up products, including Serum Foundation, Perfect Concealer and Magic Powder, which aim to both enhance appearance and promote skin health. CEO Doris Maute Bobillier says there is an increasing focus on products that not only enhance natural appearance, but also promote mental and physical wellbeing.

title: Olam Food Ingredients opens New Zealand dairy processing plant - FoodManufacture.co.uk
summary: ofi has completed a new dairy ingredients facility in New Zealand to address the innovation, traceability, and sustainable sourcing requirements of its customers. The facility will supply markets across South-East Asia, China, the Middle East, and Africa, and complements a suite of enhancements made to ofi's dairy production facility and Ingredient Excellence Centre in Johor, Malaysia. ofi is a leading dairy ingredients provider and innovator with a global portfolio of ingredients including cocoa, coffee, nuts, and spices.
